groups:concept.deftn: a recipient of the instruction or information of the resource

outline.groups:deftn: individuals who primary responsibility is to work with, process, analyze, package or redistribute Earth data sets
individuals whose determine significance, worth or condition by careful study, appraisal or assessment
individuals whose specialty is understanding information skills, methods and integration and combining this with educational technologies
individuals who investigate relevant topics, problems, issues or events in order to advance knowledge of a field
individuals working in the scientific arena but who position is more operations oriented rather than research oriented
individuals who manage others, large projects or budgets within an organization
individuals generally above the age of 18 who have returned to or are starting out in a formal academic environment
individual who are taking college-level and often college-credit courses in high school
individuals who are struggling in a school setting and may be in danger of dropping out because of social, economic or psychological factors
individuals fluent in multiple languages usually the dominant language of the learning situation and another language
a learning setting with culturally differentiated groups
individuals responsible for defining or managing sets of courses constituting an academic area of specialization
individuals with developmental challenges due to their social environment
learners with any handicaps whether it be physical, emotional, developmental, economic, hearing or vision
individuals facing challenges due to their financial or economic situation
educators whose primary responsibility it is to instruct students in kindergarten through grade five
individuals who are emotionally challenged

outline.groups:vocab: GEM:English as a second language (ESL) students
outline.text: English as a second language (ESL) students
outline.groups:deftn: individuals whose first language is a language other than English
individuals in the general population
individuals taking courses above grade level
individuals with no or minimal abilities to hear the spoken word
individuals who may have visual, auditory, spatial, conceptual, memory or behavioral deficits that benefit from alternative or multiple teaching methods in order to understand topics and concepts
specialists in the care and management of a library or collections of related items
individuals who have only a slight understanding of or ability to speak English
educators whose primary responsibility is to instruct students in grades six through eight.
individuals that are in disproportionate representation in STEM (science, technology, mathematics, engineering) disciplines; includes ethnicity, gender or socioeconomic populations

individuals who consider themselves teachers or instructors but may not be formally associated with an institution or organization and who may teach across all grade ranges and ages (e.g. professional tutors)
individuals who raise or care for offspring or other persons
individuals with physical challenges or handicaps; does not include hearing or vision-impaired learners
individuals whose primary responsibility is to develop and define plans, rules, strategies, guidelines, principles, actions or procedures for institutions or government agencies
individuals taking courses that are generally deemed below grade level
individuals in school settings that are located in country or agricultural areas
educators whose primary responsibility is to instruct students in grades nine through twelve.
individuals pursuing a teaching certificate and who are currently working in a classroom setting.
individuals who investigate topics, problems, issues or events in order to advance their own knowledge, skills or understanding; often in a structured learning environment or through self-study
individuals with more than one physical, developmental, or emotional challenge
individuals in school settings adjacent or within commuting distance of major cities
individuals who manage others or projects within an organization
individuals who train professional teachers
individuals whose primary responsibility or occupation is the instruction of others
educators whose occupation is teaching or instructing
educators at the college level who teach primarily undergraduate and graduate students
learners within a city setting
individuals whose eyesight is limited or no longer functioning
